Commodity Trading

Commodity Trading Introduction Business Flows Use Case: 1 Direct trading Purchase Order >> Receipt >> Bill >> Sales Order>> Delivery Use Case: 2 Dropship material directly to customer Create Sales Order >> RFQ created based on Vendor defined on product >>confirm Purchase order >> Dropship created. Use Case: 3 Sell after processing Material internally Purchase different Commodities >> receipt >> Blending Process (Manufacturing Order) >> material availability of FG >> Sales order >> Delivery

Introduction

This configuration is quite useful for traders who deal with commodities like Soybeans, Rice, Sugar, Wheat, Corn, Cotton Etc. CRM, Sales, Purchase, Inventory, Manufacturing, Quality, Accounting Application will be useful to setup configuration.

Commodity trading business required certain requirements like weighing scale data, specific quality check & parameters check inputs during GRN activities.

For most purchases they keep the broker in the loop who is in direct contact with an actual vendor. The broker is responsible for the quality of products & He Gets a commission from the trader for assistance in managing processes.

They generally doing business with following flow as explained in detail below.

Business Flows

Use Case: 1 Direct trading

Purchase Order >> Receipt >> Bill >> Sales Order>> Delivery

Purchase commodities from vendors locally or import & store at their different warehouses & after getting orders from their customer they will deliver to them.

1. Create purchase order, Select broker who works as a mediator between vendor & buyer & is responsible for anything unwanted that happens during delivery or in the quality of commodities. confirm the purchase order,

2. In inventory application, in the receipt menu, select the transfer that needs to be received and select the action 'select for GRN'.

3. In inventory application, in the Weighing Scale/GRN Details menu, select subsequent transfer to receive material after inputting all details of weight and material.

4. Billing will be done against the PO & received material

5. Commodity delivery to the end customer against sales order generation.

Use Case: 2 Dropship material directly to the customer

Create Sales Order >> RFQ created based on Vendor defined on product >> confirm Purchase order >> Dropship created.

For some commodities, they purchase only after getting orders from their customers; the vendor could dropship or ship the commodities to the warehouse first, & then deliver them to the customer at a later stage.

1. Create sales orders according to the customer's requirements; automatically, a request for quotation will be created according to vendor definitions over the product form (or vendor price list).

2. Based on the approval of the RFQ, a purchase order will be generated, & a dropship will be created to deliver material directly to the customer.

Use Case: 3 Sell after processing material internally.

Purchase different Commodities >> receipt >> Blending Process (Manufacturing Order) >> material availability of FG >> Sales order >> Delivery


They purchase the same commodities of different qualities & then do the blending (mixing) process to make another quality of same commodities & sell them.

1. Purchase raw materials for commodities & store them in a warehouse.

2. Create manufacturing order for Finish commodities with blending (mixing) process & complete MO to product FG in stock.

3. Create sales order to sell & deliver the FG commodities.
